reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We first visited this lovely and very French hotel 20 years ago and have wanted to return ever since. Luckily this time we could afford a room with a balcony overlooking the Mediterranean and the beautiful Porquerolles islands. It also gave us shelter from the chilly Mistral winds which sometimes occur in this part of France making the sea rather choppy. The park/gardens are very well kept with a tennis court, boules and a pool at the seas edge which would be lovely in warmer weather. Breakfast was plentiful and delicious and there is both a brasserie and more formal restaurant to choose from. Apart from rather tough pastry we enjoyed our meals very much. The airport at Hyeres just down the road makes access very easy nowadays and boats leave for the islands just over a mile away.
reviews.title: A delightful refuge from the Mistral!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a charming, family-run hotel with stunning sea views. They provide an extremely friendly and attentive service. The rooms are light, airy and comfortably furnished. It is ideal having the choice of gourmet restaurant or bar/bistro. Similarly, beneath the pines on the seafront there is a choice of lunch restaurants. All serve an excellent standard of food; reasonably

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a wonderful example of a classic French resort hotel. Only open half the year the building is furnished in traditional style, in the main part of the hotel the bedrooms are good size and furnished adequately, bathrooms are functional but quite good enough. The restaurant is comfortably old fashioned with good food, friendly correct service, including the wonderful cheese trolley that is wheeled to the table and then the escorted walk to the dessert buffet to make a choice. Down the steps outside one can walk through the private gardens to the sea-side pool.
reviews.title: BREATHTAKING VIEW

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a thoroughly pleasant place to stay, but then if you factor in the location, perched up on the edge of the village with a stunningly beautiful view over the rich green pines, out across the blue Mediterranean to Porquerolles and the other islands, all bathed in the wonderful provencal light, well you have one of the most idyllic places to stay. We have been here 3 times and will return again and again. Nothing beats an aperitif on the balcony of one of the high floor rooms savouring the magnificent view.
reviews.title: Idyllic Mediterranean Spot
